means: （商品在商店中陈列过久或被触摸过多而）残旧了的

sentence.Network_en: The old coat has shopworn in the closet for years.
sentence.Network_cn: 这件旧外套在橱中闲放已好几年了。

sentence.Network_en: He was fat and looked shopworn around the nose and mouth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他人长得胖,鼻头和嘴巴部分显出一副不合时宜的可怜相.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 寄托蓝宝书速记版 ... shoal adj. 浅的 shopworn adj. 陈旧的, 陈腐的 shrewd adj. 精明的, 机敏的.

means.word_mean: 1. worn or faded from being on display in a store;
2. repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse;

auth_sentence.content: Seven decades after the birth of the Empire State Building, the skyscraper had, he concluded, become a shopworn form.
auth_sentence.res_content: Seven decades after the birth of the Empire State Building, the skyscraper had, he concluded, become a shopworn form.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seven decades after the birth of the Empire State Building, the skyscraper had, he concluded, become a shopworn form.

auth_sentence.content: It hasn't changed much, but the buildings now have a shopworn air the fate of all shiny things.
auth_sentence.res_content: It hasn't changed much, but the buildings now have a shopworn air the fate of all shiny things.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It hasn't changed much, but the buildings now have a shopworn air the fate of all shiny things.
